div.p: I have not as yet received any letter from home. the past week having one of great disturbance and excitement there having been several skirmishes within 8 or 10 miles from this place and the R.R. between this and Memphis was slighly injured and no mails for several days. the enemy houses were worsted in every instance and have now disappeared and I hope we will have more quiet time and more business to occupy me. I didnot Sleep an hour less from the excitement mor was I at all frightened the excitement was rather pleasant than otherwise stirring up the blood which had become almost stagnated, the fort here is nearly finished and can easily withstand an attack by 20000 men nothing like which force can be found in this country the force with which they have been fighting was under the command of Forrest and Lee and was about 5,000 about 50 were killed and a small number taken prisoners who are well treated the regular soldiers particularly the Guerillas are more hardly used This place is intended to be the principal
